items: The blood of ancient legendary heroes flows through you veins granting you unimaginable power to vanquish your foes.
Warriors of such a bloodline are innately magical and cannot cast spells as their blood interferes with their ability to channel magic.

You also gain a Soulbound weapon which was passed down through the generations of your bloodline, this weapon has a magical property for overcoming damage resistances but cannot be improved in any other way, you can summon this weapon as a bonus action, whenever you are more than 15 feet away from the weapon it disappears out of existance, whenever you use a weapon other than your Soulbound one you do so at a disadvantage.
Whenever you reach 3rd level in this Archetype you learn maneuvers that are fueled by special resource called Focus.
Maneuvers. You learn two basic maneuvers of your choice, which are listed under "Maneuvers" below. Many maneuvers enhance an attack in some way. You can use only one maneuver per turn.
You learn two additional maneuvers of your choice at 7th, 10th, and 15th level. Each time you learn new maneuvers, you can also replace one maneuver you know with a different one.
Focus. Every turn in combat you gain one point of focus up to a maximum of 3, whenever you take damage you lose one point of focus, for each point of focus you gain +1 to attack and damage rolls.
Maneuvers that consume/scale with focus use the total amount before reducing your focus.
Maximum Focus increases to 4 at 5th level, 5 at 8th level, 6 at 11th level, 7 at 14th level, 8 at 17th level and 9 at 19th level.
Basic Maneuvers.

Trick Dodge. As a reaction to an attack against you that you can see, you dodge making the attack automatically miss and move at lightning fast speed in any direction for up  to [5 * Focus] feet. (Consumes 1 Focus) (Recharge 3-6)
Block. As a reaction to an attack against you that you can see you can increase your AC by [1 * Focus] until the start of your next turn. (Consumes 1 Focus)
Relentless Attacks. As a free action gain additional extra attack until the end of your turn equal to the amount of Focus you spend. (Recharge 4-6)

Mirage Blades. You create two floating spectral blades that you can launch for each point of Focus you spend, the blades deal 1d6 Piercing damage and have a range of 120 feet, they use a D20 for their attack rolls and cannot critically hit.
Rapid Slash. You dash in a straight line of up to [5 * Focus] feet, make a single melee attack against each creature on the line. (Consumes 2 Focus) (Recharge 2-6)
Advanced Maneuvers.

Devil Trigger. You take on an inhuman visage and become temporarily blessed with Demonic strength, you gain +6 to Strength and Dexterity scores until the end of your turn and immediately regenerate [CON * 4] hit points. While in this form all Focus costs are reduced by one and you can make up to 3 maneuvers per turn. (Consumes 4 Focus)

Judgement Cut. A 10 foot radius sphere of distortion and faintly visible lights appears for a split second around a creature of your choice within 60 feet, the radius of the sphere equals to [5 * Focus] feet, make a single melee attack against all enemies inside of the sphere, for each point of focus an additional damage dice. (Consumes 2 Focus) (Recharge 3-6)

Doppelganger. You create a spectral clone of your self. the clone lasts for 3 turns with an AC 14 + Focus. half your total hit points, and immunity to all conditions. If it has to make a saving throw, it uses your saving throw bonus for the roll. It is the same size as you, and it occupies its space, it otherwise functions exactly the same as your Character. (Consumes 5 Focus) (Recharge 5-6)
Superior Maneuvers.

Judgement Cut End. Your perception of time slows to a crawl until everything looks frozen in time, make a single melee attack against all creatures within a 30 foot radius around you, for each point of focus roll two additional damage dice. (Consumes 6 Focus) (Recharge 5-6)

Hell on Earth. You focus all of your legendary might into your fist before crashing it into the earth and dealing bludgeoning damage. The damage of this attack is increased by 10 and the radius by 5 feet for each point of Focus spent, requires at least 6 points of Focus. (Recharge 6)

subclassFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries:
When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.
